sub_title: Assistant Professor at Maastricht University in the Netherlands, and Visiting Research Fellow at the Centre for Appearance Research in the United Kingdom
summary:
I am an Assistant Professor at Maastricht University in the Netherlands, and a Visiting Research Fellow at the Centre for Appearance Research in the United Kingdom. 

As a researcher, my key mission is to improve the way that people think and feel about their own body. My research projects are centred around this aim. They focus primarily on investigating (1) how negative body image is caused and maintained; (2) how people can develop and maintain a positive body image; and (3) intervention techniques for fostering a more positive body image. My research techniques span both quantitative and qualitative methods.  

At Maastricht University, I am also the coordinator of Mind Your Body, a course in the Bachelor of Psychology concerning body image research. In addition, I am an Associate Editor for Body Image: An International Journal of Research, and a consultant for EVERYBODY Consulting and for Meta.

awards.title: Recipient of the China Scholarship Council Grant (co-applicant) from the Chinese Scholarship Council
awards.description: This grant is to fully finance a four-year PhD project (student Yi Wu) that aims to investigate body image and attitudes towards cosmetic surgery among Chinese and Dutch women.

awards.title: Recipient of the UM Diversity and Inclusivity Grant (co-applicant) from Maastricht University
awards.description: This grant is to finance the development of Female Empowerment Maastricht (FEM), a professional network to support and cultivate female leadership at Maastricht University, and foster a culture of gender equity and diversity. Collaborators include Christina Peristeridou, Alie de Boer, Aurélie Carlier, and Christel van Gool,

awards.title: Recipient of the UM Diversity and Inclusivity Grant from Maastricht University
awards.description: This grant is to finance a project that aims to investigate and cultivate a more diverse and inclusive sports environment at the University. Collaborators include Carolien Martijn, Latifa Abidi, Anna Harris, Kelly Geyskens, Netty Bekkers-Vos, Ophélie Hue, and Rosa Dreyhaupt.

awards.title: Recipient of the Distinguished Women Scientists Fund from the Dutch Network of Women Professors
awards.description: This award is to fund a visit to the research group of Professor Ann Frisén at the University of Gothenburg (Sweden). The purpose of the visit is to design a research line to investigate the qualitative data that we have gathered in our prior intervention research (e.g., participants’ written responses to intervention exercises).

awards.title: Seymour Fisher Outstanding Body Image Dissertation Award from Body Image: An International Journal of Research
awards.issuer: Body Image: An International Journal of Research

awards.title: Recipient of the "Rubicon Grant" from The Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO)
awards.description:
SUMMARY OF THE RESEARCH PROPOSAL:

Approximately 50% of women have a negative body image, characterised by negative thoughts and feelings about one’s own body. Negative body image is a public health concern because it has serious consequences for both physical and psychological health. Yet, existing body image interventions have only small effects. Therefore, this project aims to develop effective approaches to improving body image. I propose that body image can be effectively improved by focusing on body functionality (i.e., what the body can do, rather than how it looks). Specifically, I predict that focusing on body functionality improves body image via increased (i) body-complexity: the number of distinct aspects that comprise the body-concept; and (ii) body-self integration: the degree of integration between the body-concept and self-concept. Two randomised controlled trials will be conducted in women with a negative body image (Study 1) and women with rheumatic disease (Study 2). I will conduct the project at the Centre for Appearance Research in Bristol (England), the only centre in the world that specialises in body image research. This project will provide insight into novel mechanisms of body image improvement and could offer a feasible new approach for body image intervention.
awards.issuer: The Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO)

courses.name: Supervision of Research and Writing Assignments

profile_positions.description: My research projects focus primarily on investigating (1) how negative body image is caused and maintained; (2) how people can develop and maintain a positive body image; and (3) intervention techniques for fostering a more positive body image. My teaching activities include the coordination of Mind Your Body, a course in the Bachelor of Psychology concerning body image research, and Self-Regulation, a course in the Master of Health and Social Psychology. In addition, I supervise bachelor and master students who conduct research and/or literature reviews on topics pertaining to body image.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: My post-doc research focused on topics related to body image, including how body image is influenced and how it can be improved. In addition, I was involved in numerous teaching activities such as lecturing, Problem-Based Learning tutoring, and coordination of the course Mind Your Body.
profile_positions.title: Post-doc Researcher

profile_positions.description: My PhD project focused on interventions for improving body image. In particular, my colleagues and I conducted  (1) a meta-analysis of existing interventions designed to improve body image. We also investigated (2) cognitive bias among women with a negative body image, and (3) the benefit of focusing on the functionality of one's own body (i.e., rather than physical appearance). Aside from my research activities, I was also involved in many teaching activities (lecturing, coordinating courses), and in 2015 I obtained my Basic Teaching Qualification Certificate.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

profile_positions.description: Meta’s Body Image Expert Circle is a global, multi-disciplinary group of experts in the eating disorders and body image space who shape and inform Meta’s work to support their community, and provide independent feedback on relevant content policies, products and features across Meta’s family of apps.
profile_positions.title: Body Image Expert Circle

profile_positions.description:
EVERYBODY Consulting is a global team of world-renowned experts in body image, mental health and appearance diversity. 

We help purpose-driven brands and organisations deliver projects that drive social change and improve lives and well-being, particularly for women, girls and gender-diverse people.
profile_positions.title: Body Image Consultant

company.name: University of the West of England

profile_positions.company: University of the West of England
profile_positions.description: I am a Visiting Research Fellow at the Centre for Appearance Research (CAR) in Bristol, England (University of the West of England). My research at CAR began with the "Rubicon Grant" that I was awarded from the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO). The research project focused on novel underlying mechanisms of body image improvement. Key collaborators on this project were Professor Nichola Rumsey, Dr. Phillippa Diedrichs, and Dr. Emma Halliwell. I am currently collaborating with CAR on other on-going projects surrounding intervention techniques for improving body image.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: During my internship with the Anxiety Disorders and Psychotrauma team, I conducted intake interviews, clinical assessments, and gave cognitive behavioural therapy. In addition, I conducted a study about the effect of comorbidity on the treatment of social anxiety disorder.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: As a research assistant I helped conduct a study about "liking versus wanting" in sexual disorders.
profile_positions.title: Research assistant

profile_positions.description: My tasks as an English teacher for the Anglia Network included teaching English grammar, listening, and speaking skills to students (native Dutch or German speaking) in elementary school and in high school. The classes were part of an intensive summer school program for learning English.
profile_positions.title: English teacher

profile_positions.description: This internship took place at the Gynaecology and Maternity ward of the hospital. My tasks included assisting gynaecologists and nurses when patients were in labour, taking care of the newborn babies immediately after birth, and assisting with the nursing care of the patients during their stay at the hospital.
profile_positions.title: Intern
